articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: The top U.S. general said on Thursday Israel still has not shared much of its "day after" planning for Gaza once the war with Hamas ends.
articles.title: US not seen a detailed post-war plan from Israel: Gen. Brown

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris will sit down, separately, with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday, for high stakes talks on winding down the Gaza conflict.
articles.title: Biden, Harris to meet Netanyahu separately on Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Senior figures in Israel's government have said it is closing in on its war aims of defeating Hamas militarily and the return of hostages seized on Oct. 7. But Hamas' survival as a guerrilla force and its sway in Gaza may overshadow any deal.
articles.title: Battered Hamas confounds Israel's bid to declare victory

articles.author: Jan Strupczewski
articles.description: The Group of Seven wealthy democracies are likely to have a framework deal for a Russian-asset-backed $50 billion loan to Ukraine by October, in time to tap markets by year-end, European Economic Commissioner Paolo Gentiloni said on Thursday.
articles.title: G7 framework deal on $50 bln Ukraine loan seen in Oct, EU's Gentiloni says

articles.author: James Pearson
articles.description: North Korean hackers have conducted a global cyber espionage campaign to try to steal classified military secrets to support Pyongyang's banned nuclear weapons programme, the United States, Britain and South Korea said in a joint advisory on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korean hackers are stealing military secrets, say U.S. and allies

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres called on Thursday for countries to address the urgency of the extreme heat epidemic, fueled by climate change - days after the world registered its hottest day on record.
articles.title: UN demands action on extreme heat as world registers warmest day

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Gaemi blew through northern Taiwan on Thursday, killing two people, bringing floods and leading to traffic snarls, before heading across the sea and into China where it is expected to bring further torrential rain.
articles.title: Typhoon Gaemi barrels through Taiwan, killing two, heads to Chinese coast

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Relatives of the 18 dead in an airplane crash in Nepal have yet to hear from the government or the airline on the possible cause of the disaster, they said a day after the small jet went down during take-off at the airport in Kathmandu, the capital.
articles.title: Relatives of 18 dead in Nepal plane crash demand answers

articles.author: Jefferson Kahinju, Edwin Waita
articles.description: Kenyan police detained several people on Thursday who attempted to present a petition to the president's office and lay flowers to honour those killed a month ago on the most violent day of anti-government protests, protesters said.
articles.title: Kenyan protesters detained in march to honour fallen comrades

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian Foreign Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar met his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi on Thursday in Laos, where the two leaders agreed to resolve border issues as soon as possible.
articles.title: India and China agree to approach border issues with urgency
